title.native: BanG Dream! ガルパ☆ピコ ふぃーばー！
title.english: BanG Dream! Girls Band Party!☆PICO FEVER!

description: The third season of BanG Dream! Garupa☆Pico, announced on the live-streamed "BanG Dream! Girls Talk Party! 2021" event.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

title.native: BanG Dream! ガルパ☆ピコ~大盛り~

node.description:
Bushiroad Inc. (株式会社ブシロード, Kabushiki-gaisha Bushirōdo) is a Japanese entertainment company producer of collectible card games and trading cards, publisher of mobile apps and games, promotional items and many other venues, which was founded in 2007 by Takaaki Kidani and is headquartered in Tokyo.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bushi_PR)

[Website](http://www.nakamurakou.com/) | [Blog](http://kou.livedoor.biz/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nkkou)

Kou Nakamura is a novelist and winner of the 39th Bungei Prize in 2002. He also won the Noma Literary Newcomer Prize in 2004.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asuka_oda)

A lyricist affiliated with Elements Garden.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/amane_bushi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/amane_shindo_official/) |  [Agency Profile](https://hibiki-cast.jp/hibiki_f/shindou_amane/)__

A voice actor affiliated with Hibiki and the main vocalist in the band [Morfonica](https://anilist.co/staff/162066/Morfonica), as a part of the BanG Dream! franchise. She is also part of the duo Oyunesu with Yuka Nishio.

Amane was scouted in 2018 by Hibiki at 14 years old, making her the youngest voice actress to join the agency at the time. She then debuted with the role of Caro in the anime Bermuda Triangle: Colorful Pastrale. The band Morfonica and her role as its vocalist and Mashiro Kurata's voice actor was announced in early 2020; prior to this, she was a big BanG Dream! fan, with Pastel*Palettes being her favorite band. Besides Bandori, Amane is also an avid fan of Love Live! and Revue Starlight, and likes posting her gacha rolls from their games on Twitter. She also enjoys playing #COMPASS (COMbat Providence AnalysiS System) and Blazblue.

Amane's other hobbies include collecting stuffed animals (especially marine animals), singing, and illustrating. She also knows how to play the electric guitar, is learning how to play the acoustic guitar, and knows how to dance (cheer, ballet, and hiphop). She likes horror movies, dislikes sweet foods, and has an older sister. Her favorite colors are pink and green, and her favorite foods are Dr. Pepper, cup yakisoba, mayo beam, poached chicken breast, cheese, iekei ramen, meat, wakame stems, matcha, and raw seafood.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimi_sound) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimin_official/)

A voice actor and musician, notably the lead vocalist and guitarist of [Poppin'Party](https://anilist.co/staff/153185/PoppinParty). Aimi had dreamed of becoming a singer ever since she was young. She initially only aspired to become a singer, but she became interested in voice acting after becoming familiar with the anime series Macross Frontier, where she was impressed at how the series was able to combine music and animation in its storytelling. 

In order to make her dream come true, she participated in various contests, such as the “Best of Singer Contest National Championship 2008”, which she made into the Finals but lost. She was one of 3rd ANIMAX Anison Grand Prix Finalists with Sayaka Sasaki in 2009, and was a winner of the Osaka block. On February 6th, 2010, she made it to the finals of the “Aim for Ellie! Milky Holmes Seiyuu Audition”, a seiyuu audition tour hosted by DWANGO Creative School, but lost the role to Mikoi Sasaki. However, she did make her debut as a seiyuu in the Milky Holmes anime.

Aimi was the guitarist of a girls' band in high school and self-taught, but quit playing after graduating. She picked it up back in 2014 and used it to perform during her THE iDOLM@STER Million Live! live performances as Julia. Aimi is the influence and where Kidani Takaaki, the president of Bushiroad, got his idea for the BanG Dream! franchise from - after seeing Aimi playing the guitar during THE IDOLM@STER M@STERS OF IDOL WORLD!! 2014. 

She used her full name for her voice actress career and Aimi (愛美) for her singer career, but she started to use the latter for both since December 2013.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Brünhilde - Azur Lane (VG)
- Mica - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Serval - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Yan - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Cristallo - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

__[Profile](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/fujita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Junpei_Fujita)__

Member of the "music production brand" Elements Garden.

__[Profile](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/fujita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Junpei_Fujita)__

Member of the "music production brand" Elements Garden.

**Height:** 164 cm
**Office:** Voice Kit

[Profile (Voice Kit)](https://voicekit.jp/talent/maeshimaami/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_maeshima_ami) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/maeshima_ami) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_maeshima_ami/)

Ami Maeshima is a Japanese idol, actress, and YouTuber. She is best known for being the voice actress of Aya Maruyama from BanG Dream! and as a former member of Super Girls.

On 30 November 2022, it was announced that Maeshima would go on hiatus from all entertainment activities due to health issues. As a result, she terminated her contract with Avex Inc. and she stepped down from her roles as Aya Maruyama in BanG Dream! and Ibuki Niijima in D4DJ.

On September 1, 2023, Ami had announced that she had recovered, and that she would return to all her entertainment activities, returning to voice Aya Maruyama.

[Website](https://hibiki-cast.jp/hibiki_f/aiba/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aibaaiai) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aiba_aiai/)

A voice actor and the lead singer of the band [Roselia](https://anilist.co/staff/153170/Roselia). Before becoming a seiyuu, she was a professional wrestler under the name "Yuuki Harima" for about 2 years, and also worked as a stage actress.

Aina is energetic, jokes around a lot, and often has a hard time staying in-character. One of her hobbies is looking after race horses. She also loves singing karaoke; one of her favorite songs to sing is "only my railgun."

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")
__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise (2010-2022), Aoni Production (2022-present)

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/sakura-ayane.html) | [Blog (old)](http://www.joqr.co.jp/blog/sakura/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayane.sakura.mg/)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Nearl - Arknights (VG)
- Yae Miko - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Yae Sakura - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Julia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Dolla - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Devonica - Ohsama Sentai King-Ohger: Adventure Heaven (Movie)
- Rio Sonogami - Date a Live: Rio Reincarnation (VG)
- Prinz Eugen - Azur Lane (VG)

[Profile (Style Cube)](http://stylecube.jp/talents/miku/index.html) | [Profile (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/itomiku/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/itou-miku/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/InfoItomiku) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/itomiku_official/) | [LINE](https://page.line.me/itomiku_official) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miku_Itō) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤美来)

Miku joined the idol unit [StylipS](https://anilist.co/staff/111177) on April 27, 2013 and is one half of its subunit, [Pyxis](https://anilist.co/staff/139753), along with [Moe Toyota](https://anilist.co/staff/118398). 

Miku's hobbies include watching anime, dancing, and playing Hyakunin Isshu. She also practices kendo (but is at the lowest level) and enjoys acting. She is a fan of Kamen Rider, and her favorite rider is Den-O.

**Non-anime roles:**
• Fu Xuan - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
• Olivia - Memento Mori (VG)
• Kolulu - Granblue Fantasy (VG)
• Indomitable - Azur Lane (VG)
• Liv - Punishing: Gray Raven (VG)
• Agnès Claudel - Kiseki Series (VG)

__Height:__ 170 cm (5'7")

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Lay0113) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/raychell0113/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/laysinger) | [Website](https://avex.jp/raychell/) | [Agency Profile](http://acecrew.co.jp/artist/raychell.html)

The vocalist and bassist in the BanG Dream! project band [RAISE A SUILEN](https://anilist.co/staff/153132/RAISE-A-SUILEN), as well as one of the vocalists in the visual kei band SHAZNA, in which she is one of three new members since they officially reunited in August 2017. Raychell is currently affiliated with Rhythm Zone, while her singing activities are signed under Ace Crew Entertainment. She was previously a solo singer and went under the name LAY in 2010-2013. Under Avex, she released the album "Are you ready to FIGHT", and a mini-album, "0". Raychell had no experience in voice acting prior to her role as LAYER in BanG Dream!.

She has been hosting a radio corner on NACK5 called "R World Radio" every Wednesday since late 2010, which Sae Otsuka used to be a frequent guest on. Raychell also has an older brother.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia, edited)
